unnormalised: **Automotive News: A Flurry of Vehicle Launches Drive Innovation**
normalised: **Automotive News: A Flurry of Vehicle Launches Drive Innovation**

unnormalised: The Indian automotive sector is witnessing a surge in new vehicle launches, reflecting a growing consumer base and increased manufacturing capabilities. Dr. Meena Iyer, head of Automotive Research at IIT Madras, notes a trend towards electric vehicles (EVs) and hybrid technologies, driven by stricter emission norms and government incentives like the FAME scheme.
normalised: The Indian automotive sector is witnessing a surge in new vehicle launches, reflecting a growing consumer base and increased manufacturing capabilities. Doctor Meena Iyer, head of Automotive Research at I I T Madras, notes a trend towards electric vehicles (E Vs) and hybrid technologies, driven by stricter emission norms and government incentives like the F A M E scheme.

unnormalised: This month saw the launch of the "Vayu," a compact SUV by Mahindra, boasting a fuel efficiency of 25 kmpl. Tata Motors also unveiled its much-anticipated "Indica Evolve," an all-electric hatchback targeting the budget-conscious consumer with an introductory price of Rs. 7.99 Lakh.
normalised: This month saw the launch of the "Vayu," a compact S U V by Mahindra, boasting a fuel efficiency of twenty five kilometer per liter. Tata Motors also unveiled its much-anticipated "Indica Evolve," an all-electric hatchback targeting the budget-conscious consumer with an introductory price of rupee seven point ninety nine lakh.

unnormalised: Industry experts predict that these launches will further intensify competition, pushing manufacturers to innovate in areas such as fuel efficiency, safety features, and connected car technologies. The upcoming Auto Expo in Delhi is expected to showcase even more cutting-edge vehicles, solidifying India's position as a major automotive hub. Expect displays covering hundreds of sq ft, dedicated to showcasing new technologies. A major focus is on localization of parts, reducing reliance on imports and boosting the “Make in India” initiative.
